channel.title: Developments on Core Rule Set Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Developments on Core Rule Set Documentation

item.title: Rule IDs
item.description: Why do rule IDs matter? Each rule added to a ModSecurity instance must have a unique ID (in recent versions of modsec). As a result of this it is important that IDs be generated in a preplanned way such that they don't overlap with other rules. This becomes particularly important when it comes to rulesets, like OWASP CRS. Because CRS can be used with other rule sets (in fact it is designed to be used with the Trustwave commercial rules, for instance) it is important that no two rulesets have overlapping ID ranges.
